messages.content: What are gateway functions?

Gateway functions are the doors between the four sides of your mind. First function (hero), fourth function (inferior), fifth function (nemesis), and eighth function (demon). Master these and you control transitions between ego, subconscious, unconscious, and superego. Fuck these up and you get thrown around involuntarily.
How do I access my subconscious?

Through your inferior function - the fourth slot. You approach it two ways: from fear or from aspiration. Fear gives you shit results. Aspiration gives you growth. Want to unlock your subconscious? Get over your fear. Read books. Kill the insecurity in that inferior function and suddenly you have access to a whole new side of yourself.
What's the difference between ego and superego?

Your ego is who you are - your conscious mind's apex. Your superego is your demon side - the source of human corruption, sin nature, whatever you want to call it. They're locked in forever combat. The superego wants to replace the ego, bend the self upon itself. It's insanely powerful but makes Faustian deals. You get your wish but pay a massive price.
How does an ESTP access their INFJ subconscious?

Through their Ni inferior. The ESTP needs to stop scattering with Se and focus. When they aspire to know what they want instead of staying insecure, they tap into that INFJ sage. Suddenly they can mentor people, use Fe for emotional support, guide someone from omega to alpha. But if they approach from insecurity - just reacting with Se aggression - they get nowhere.
Why do introverts and extroverts have different energy patterns?

Extroversion is three or more people. Introversion is one-on-one or alone. Introverts have introverted egos - they gain mental energy from solitude or one-on-one time. Extroverts lose energy in those situations. They need groups to recharge. Your ego's orientation determines where your mental energy flows. Spend too much time in your introverted sides as an extrovert and you drain out.
How do I develop my unconscious?

Get over your worry. The unconscious gateway is your nemesis function - fifth slot. Worrying keeps your unconscious immature. For Si users, stop worrying about comfort and past experiences. Face your worries head-on. Seek failure because failure teaches wisdom. A mature unconscious gives you self-discipline, organization, procedures. An immature one keeps you impulsive and closed-minded.
What happens when you make a deal with your demon?

You get power but at a massive cost. The demon grants wishes like a genie - you ask it to save the world from bad people, it turns the world into a desert wasteland. Yeah, the people are gone, but so is everything else. It gives you an inch and takes a mile. Don't make Faustian deals with your eighth function unless you have nothing to lose and everything to gain.
When should I actually use my superego?

When you've hit rock bottom and your ego, subconscious, and unconscious have all failed. When you have nothing to lose and everything to gain. The superego resets your life - sets it on fire so you can rebuild. It's not literal self-destruction. It's burning down toxic situations, walking away from marriages that are dead, eliminating what's holding you back. Use it as a last resort reset button.
Why do ESTPs struggle with commitment?

Because their Si nemesis makes them worry they're not getting enough experiences. Their Ni inferior means they don't know what they want. These two team up into a fear-based worry complex. Result? Serial monogamy, nymphomania tendencies, illicit relationships until midlife crisis hits at 40. They need to get over fear and worry, seek failure to gain wisdom, mature their unconscious for actual devotion.
What does integration mean?

All four sides of your mind working together harmoniously. Ego, subconscious, unconscious, and superego fully integrated. It's enlightenment - your highest self. You get there by getting over fear, getting over worry, and recognizing when you've hit rock bottom. Stop being afraid. Stop worrying. Take control. That's integration.
How do you feed the demon without letting it take over?

Give it small concessions. Keep it content but confined. You can't just cage a wild creature and expect compliance. If you starve the demon by ignoring it completely, it breaks out and devastates everything. Throw it some meat. Let it out in controlled ways. Trying to suppress it entirely just empowers it until it explodes and wrecks your life.
What's the relationship between failure and wisdom?

Failure is the best teacher. Period. You don't get wisdom from comfort - you get it from facing challenges and setbacks. Embracing failure kills fear and worry. It develops both your subconscious and unconscious. Wisdom solves problems, and you gain wisdom by being open to failure. Stop avoiding it. Seek it out. That's how you grow.
Why can't you just ignore your demon function?

Because ignoring it makes it stronger. It's like telling people not to have premarital sex - they do it anyway. Human nature opposes direct restriction. When you put bars around the demon and starve it, it grows hungry and angry. Eventually it breaks free and causes way more destruction than if you'd just managed it properly from the start.
How does an ENTP look like an ENTJ when developed?

When an ENTP gets over their worry and develops their INTJ unconscious, they gain access to strategic thinking, organization, procedures, self-discipline. Suddenly they look like they have Te parent when really it's a developed Si child working with their Ti parent. The INTJ shadow becomes accessible. They get organized, scheduled, process-oriented - looks like Te but it's actually mature unconscious.
What's the difference between inferior aspirational and inferior insecure?

Same function, totally different outcomes. Aspirational inferior means you're approaching it with confidence and growth mindset - you want to develop it. Insecure inferior means you're coming from fear and weakness. An ESTP with aspirational Ni focuses and knows what they want. An ESTP with insecure Ni doesn't know what they want and defaults to Se aggression. Aspiration unlocks your subconscious. Insecurity keeps you trapped.
Why does spending time in your unconscious drain mental energy?

Because if you're an extrovert with an extroverted ego, your unconscious is introverted. Operating there means you're functioning in an opposite energy orientation. You lose mental energy and have to return to your ego to recharge. Same works in reverse - introverted ego with extroverted unconscious. You can't live in your unconscious permanently. You have to cycle back to your natural state.
What happens when you stay in worry too long?

Your unconscious stays immature. You become impulsive, closed-minded, assume everyone around you is stupid. You behave immorally and destroy other people's futures. For ESTPs specifically - they can't access their ISTJ unconscious for self-discipline and organization. They stay scattered, can't commit, serial monogamy until everything crashes. Get over worry or stay stuck in immaturity.
How do you know when you've hit rock bottom?

When your ego, subconscious, and unconscious have all failed and you have nothing left to lose. That's when the superego becomes useful. You're at a point where setting your life on fire actually makes sense because staying where you are guarantees continued failure. Nothing to lose, everything to gain. That's rock bottom - and that's when you use the demon to reset everything.
